page.title: 04RUNWELL HALL FARM
page.content: { Runwell Hall Farm There are 35 different machines on the farm, including one combine harvester. The animals consist of 2 bulls, about 260 cattle including the calves. There are 520 acres of land. 3 men work the farm. Half is put down to grass, the other half, 160 acres, to winter wheat, of which 196 tons are produced. 600 tons of silage is made. { { G.W. SMITH AND SON Wholesale fruit and vegetable merchant. Started in 1923 as market garden, now 53 acres, 6 fields growing 600 apple trees. Fruit and vegetables are brought from all over the world and sold to local shops. The biggest change to the business was the introduction of pallets, because they took away the work of many men.
